bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Albert E. Truby, October 1, 1940

div1.p: Hench thanks Truby for his map notations.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Albert E. Truby, October 1, 1940
div1.opener:
Lazear Memorial picture sent
October 1, 1940
General Albert E. Truby
145 Laurel St.
San Francisco, California
My dear General Truby:
div1.p:
I cannot tell you how much I appreciate your wonderful help and your
most interesting notes. My delay in acknowledging them was occasioned by
the fact that after all I am a practising physician, and at the moment am
trying hard to finish an awful job which is my annual chore--the preparation
of our annual Rheumatism Review. Permit me to send you by separate post
one of these which may interest you.

I had some very interesting correspondence from General Kean, and a
month or so from now I hope to correspond with you more intimately, exchang-
ing information which I got from General Kean, Dr. Cooke and others. I am
particularly grateful for your notations on the maps and for your suggestions
as to the realignment of the camp, particularly in the model. I can't quite
understand, however, how they could have made the mistake in getting the model
together. You remember, in the picture the model is in two sections and
possibly they did get the one section tacked on to the other section improperly,
but were they to do otherwise, the board would be irregularly shaped.

I will send you another photograph the next time I write, and in the
meantime will take this up with General Kean also.
div1.closer: Very truly yours, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
